Abs.name: Crunches
instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor
Place hands behind your head or cross them on your chest
Lift your upper body towards your knees
Slowly lower back down

Abs.name: Leg Raises
instructions: Lie flat on your back with legs straight
Place hands under your glutes for support
Lift legs straight up until perpendicular to floor
Slowly lower legs back down without touching floor

Abs.name: Plank
instructions: Start in push-up position with elbows under shoulders
Keep body in straight line from head to heels
Engage core and hold position
Don't let hips sag or rise

Abs.name: Russian Twists
instructions: Sit on floor with knees bent and feet elevated
Lean back slightly keeping back straight
Twist torso from side to side
Keep core engaged throughout movement
Abs.benefits: Develops oblique muscles and rotational strength

Abs.name: Mountain Climbers
instructions: Start in plank position
Bring one knee towards chest
Quickly switch legs in running motion
Maintain steady pace and tight core

Chest.name: Bench Press
instructions: Lie flat on bench with feet on floor
Grip barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width
Lower bar to mid-chest with control
Press bar back to starting position
Chest.benefits: Builds overall chest mass and strength

Chest.name: Incline Dumbbell Press
instructions: Set bench to 30-45 degree incline
Hold dumbbells at chest level with palms forward
Press dumbbells upward until arms are extended
Lower with control back to start

Chest.name: Push-Ups
instructions: Start in plank position with hands shoulder-width apart
Lower body until chest nearly touches floor
Keep elbows close to body
Push back to starting position
Chest.benefits: Bodyweight chest builder, no equipment needed

Chest.name: Cable Crossovers
instructions: Set cables to high position
Stand in middle with one handle in each hand
Bring hands together in front of chest
Return with control to starting position
Chest.benefits: Isolates chest and creates chest definition

Chest.name: Dips
instructions: Grip parallel bars and lift yourself up
Lean forward slightly to emphasize chest
Lower body until shoulders are below elbows
Push back up to starting position
Chest.benefits: Builds lower chest and triceps strength

Back.name: Pull-Ups
instructions: Grip bar slightly wider than shoulder-width
Hang with arms fully extended
Pull body up until chin clears bar
Lower with control to starting position
Back.benefits: Builds back width and overall upper body strength

Back.name: Bent-Over Rows
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Bend knees slightly and hinge at hips
Grip barbell with overhand grip
Pull bar to lower chest, squeeze back muscles

Back.name: Lat Pulldowns
instructions: Sit at lat pulldown machine
Grip bar wider than shoulder-width
Pull bar down to upper chest
Return with control to starting position

Back.name: Deadlifts
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, barbell over mid-foot
Bend at hips and knees to grip bar
Keep back straight and lift bar by extending hips
Stand tall, then lower bar with control
Back.benefits: Full body compound movement, builds overall strength

Back.name: Seated Cable Rows
instructions: Sit at cable row machine with feet braced
Grip handle with neutral grip
Pull handle to abdomen, squeeze shoulder blades
Return with control to starting position

Shoulders.name: Overhead Press
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Grip barbell at shoulder level
Press barbell overhead until arms are fully extended
Lower with control to starting position
Shoulders.benefits: Builds overall shoulder mass and strength

Shoulders.name: Lateral Raises
instructions: Stand holding dumbbells at sides
Raise arms out to sides until parallel to floor
Keep slight bend in elbows
Lower with control to starting position

Shoulders.name: Front Raises
instructions: Stand holding dumbbells in front of thighs
Raise one arm forward until parallel to floor
Alternate arms or do both simultaneously
Lower with control to starting position

Shoulders.name: Face Pulls
instructions: Set cable at upper chest height
Grip rope attachment with both hands
Pull rope towards face, separating hands at end
Squeeze rear delts and upper back
Shoulders.benefits: Improves posture and rear delt development

Shoulders.name: Arnold Press
instructions: Sit on bench with back support
Start with dumbbells at shoulder height, palms facing you
Press upward while rotating palms to face forward
Reverse motion on the way down
Shoulders.benefits: Targets all three deltoid heads comprehensively

Arms.name: Bicep Curls
instructions: Stand holding dumbbells at sides with palms forward
Curl one arm up towards shoulder
Squeeze bicep at top of movement
Lower with control and alternate arms

Arms.name: Tricep Pushdowns
instructions: Stand facing cable machine with rope attachment
Grip rope with palms facing each other
Push rope down until arms are fully extended
Return with control to starting position

Arms.name: Hammer Curls
instructions: Stand holding dumbbells with palms facing each other
Curl both arms up simultaneously
Keep palms facing each other throughout movement
Lower with control to starting position
Arms.benefits: Builds arm thickness and forearm strength

Arms.name: Skull Crushers
instructions: Lie on bench holding EZ bar above chest
Lower bar towards forehead by bending elbows
Keep upper arms stationary
Extend arms back to starting position
Arms.benefits: Targets long head of triceps for arm size

Arms.name: Preacher Curls
instructions: Sit at preacher bench with arms resting on pad
Curl dumbbell up towards shoulders
Squeeze bicep at top of movement
Lower with control to starting position

Legs.name: Squats
instructions: Stand with barbell across upper back
Keep chest up and back straight
Lower until thighs are parallel to floor
Drive through heels to return to standing
Legs.benefits: King of leg exercises, builds overall leg strength

Legs.name: Leg Press
instructions: Sit in leg press machine with feet shoulder-width
Lower weight until knees are at 90 degrees
Press platform away until legs are extended
Don't lock knees at top
Legs.benefits: Builds quad strength with less spinal loading

Legs.name: Lunges
instructions: Stand with feet together
Step forward with one leg and lower hips
Keep front knee behind toes
Push back to starting position

Legs.name: Romanian Deadlifts
instructions: Stand holding barbell with overhand grip
Keep legs slightly bent and back straight
Hinge at hips, lowering barbell down legs
Return to standing by squeezing glutes
Legs.benefits: Excellent for hamstring and glute development

Legs.name: Calf Raises
instructions: Stand on calf raise machine with shoulders under pads
Lower heels as far as possible
Raise onto toes as high as possible
Squeeze calves at top of movement

Cardio.name: Running
instructions: Start with 5-minute warm-up walk
Gradually increase to running pace
Maintain steady breathing rhythm
Cool down with 5-minute walk
Cardio.benefits: Improves cardiovascular health and burns calories

Cardio.name: Jump Rope
instructions: Hold rope handles with elbows close to body
Jump with both feet, keeping jumps small
Maintain consistent rhythm
Land softly on balls of feet
Cardio.benefits: High calorie burn and improves coordination

Cardio.name: Cycling
instructions: Adjust seat to proper height
Maintain steady pedaling rhythm
Keep upper body relaxed
Vary resistance for interval training
Cardio.benefits: Low impact cardio, great for knee health

Cardio.name: HIIT (High-Intensity Interval Training)
instructions: 30 seconds high intensity exercise
30 seconds rest or low intensity
Repeat for 20-30 minutes
Include exercises like burpees, mountain climbers, jumping jacks
Cardio.benefits: Maximum calorie burn in minimal time, EPOC effect

Cardio.name: Swimming
instructions: Start with warm-up laps
Use different strokes (freestyle, breaststroke)
Maintain steady breathing pattern
Cool down with slow laps
Cardio.benefits: Full body workout, zero impact on joints

WeightLoss.name: Burpees
instructions: Start in standing position
Drop into squat position with hands on floor
Kick feet back into plank position
Do a push-up, then return to squat and jump up
WeightLoss.benefits: Full body exercise that maximizes calorie burn

WeightLoss.name: Kettlebell Swings
instructions: Stand with feet wider than shoulders
Hold kettlebell with both hands
Hinge at hips and swing kettlebell between legs
Thrust hips forward to swing kettlebell to chest height
WeightLoss.benefits: Builds explosive power and burns fat efficiently

WeightLoss.name: Box Jumps
instructions: Stand facing box with feet shoulder-width
Swing arms and jump onto box
Land softly with knees slightly bent
Step back down and repeat

WeightLoss.name: Battle Ropes
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Hold one rope in each hand
Alternate arms in wave motion
Maintain fast pace for duration
WeightLoss.benefits: High-intensity cardio that builds upper body endurance

WeightLoss.name: Rowing Machine
instructions: Start with legs extended, leaning slightly back
Pull handle to chest while leaning back
Extend arms forward, then bend knees to return
Maintain smooth, continuous motion
WeightLoss.benefits: Full body cardio that builds endurance
